meanings.definition: The act of making something theatrical.
meanings.sent1: The theatricalization of the play brought it to life on stage.
meanings.sent2: The theatricalization of the book turned it into an exciting performance.
meanings.sent3: The theatricalization of the bedtime story made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: Her theatricalization of the historical event was both captivating and informative.
meanings.sent5: Through theatricalization, the dull script became a vibrant spectacle.

meanings.definition: The process of adapting something for the stage.
meanings.sent1: The theatricalization of the novel involved creating sets and costumes.
meanings.sent2: During the theatricalization of the movie, the actors rehearsed their lines.
meanings.sent3: The theatricalization of the song required choreographing dance moves.
meanings.sent4: In the theatricalization of the poem, the words came to life through performance.
meanings.sent5: Through theatricalization, the story was transformed into a theatrical masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The transformation of a story into a theatrical production.
meanings.sent1: The theatricalization of the fairy tale added music and dance.
meanings.sent2: The theatricalization of the legend brought it to the theater stage.
meanings.sent3: The theatricalization of the myth made the audience gasp in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her theatricalization of the folklore tale was a hit with the audience.
meanings.sent5: Through theatricalization, the narrative became a captivating theatrical experience.
